review_title: Dysfunctional, incompetent, poorly managed -- STAY AWAY
job_title: Full Time Faculty in Dallas, TX
pros: ERS benefits - that's it
cons: UNT Dallas was a fledgling, new university 10+ years ago but you'd think they just opened their doors the other day. Process and procedure is not in place. They have no idea what they're doing. Where process and procedure exist, it's poorly executed. Staff is so incompetent that upon my resignation they bungled my pay and benefits so badly that it took months of work to receive what they owed me. And they acted as if they were doing me a favor by paying me months later. I was once personally sued because the university didn't pay for a conference registration they sent me to. The place is a dumpster on fire rolling off of a cliff. Expect nothing but anguish and frustration at this place. Leadership is not transparent. The faculty tenure process is a mystery and highly political. There is no support or direction provided for this important process. It seems tenure is often denied or granted on a whim. Faculty are beaten down and disgruntled by the dysfunction and incompetence, but many have just accepted their fate. Others have left. Faculty turnover is high and typically replaced by lecturers or adjuncts. I waited for years thinking it would soon get better -- it never did. Only being at a new higher education institution that is well-managed and transparent can I see in hindsight what a poorly run disaster UNT Dallas was. It was as if they were making it all up as they went along. Resigning was the best decision I ever made.

pros: Small institution so easy to get to know students
cons: Small institution so you may do everything without support

pros: Great support system from faculty and staff.

cons: Pay is low. I think it could be a little better.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Love the students and fellow faculty. Everyone is happy!
cons: The university is new so sometimes funding is unclear going into the future.

review_title: Go somewhere else if you have choice
pros:
Small and young campus, so everyone knows everyone. You run into all kinds of people.
You have chance to take responsibility for something you didn't do.
cons:
Super high turn over, people come and go. Unqualified management everywhere. You can meet management leaders fired from Dallas College and UTA, they worth to be fired again. The jobs in UNTD are the last choice for many employees. 
Several management leaders only care about how to escape from obligations and blame other people/departments. You will be blamed for many things that you are not in charge of.
Compensation is low compare to peer universities. location is tough.
If you have no choice but UNTD's offer, go for it. Otherwise, go somewhere else.
